item.title: JavaScript
NodeJS Main
item.description: node -v - Check installed NodeJS version npm -v - Check Node Package Manager version const name = 'Giles'; `Hello ${name}; Ctl + C to exit the read-evaluate-print loop (REPL) console. Your First Console App The process.argv property in the standard library returns an array containing the command line arguments: The first element (0) is the node command itself The second element (1) is the script you’re running (hello.js) The third element (2) is the first argument passed The below program will take the first argument passed and use it as the name argument within the console log statement.
